name: Clearbit modules
title: Clearbit modules

children.text: After connecting to the Clearbit app, you can use the following modules to build your
Retrieves a person and company simultaneously based on an email address.

data.label: Clearbit
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Clearbit account.

children.text: Enter the email address to look up.
Enter the first name of the person.
Enter the last name of the person. If you have this, specifying this is strongly recommended to improve match rates.
Enter the IP address of the person. If you have this, specifying this is strongly recommended to improve match rates.
The city or country where the person resides.
The name of the person’s company.
The domain of the person’s company.
The LinkedIn URL for the person.
The Twitter handle for the person.
Enter The Facebook URL for the person.
to exclude person records with country data in the EU. Select
exclude eu records or with null country data
to exclude person records with country data in the EU or with null country data.
Subscribe to changes for this person ?
option to subscribe to the changes to the person.
If you subscribe, every update of this person's information will trigger a webhook and count as an API call on Clearbit. You can set the webhook URL associated with your account on your
trigger module to receive the updated information.
Retrieves a person by their email address. Alongside the email address you may also provide any additional attributes you have about the person.

data.label: Clearbit
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Clearbit account.

children.text: Enter the email address to look up.
Enter the first name of the person.
Enter the last name of the person. If you have this, specifying this is strongly recommended to improve match rates.
Enter the IP address of the person. If you have this, specifying this is strongly recommended to improve match rates.
The city or country where the person resides.
The name of the person’s company.
The domain of the person’s company.
The LinkedIn URL for the person.
The Twitter handle for the person.
Enter The Facebook URL for the person.
to exclude person records with country data in the EU. Select
exclude eu records or with null country data
to exclude person records with country data in the EU or with null country data.
Subscribe to changes for this person ?
option to subscribe to the changes to the person.
If you subscribe, every update of this person's information will trigger a webhook and count as an API call on Clearbit. You can set the webhook URL associated with your account on your
trigger module to receive the updated information.
Retrieves company data via a domain name.

data.label: Clearbit
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Clearbit account.

children.text: Enter the domain of the company’s website.
Enter the name of the company.
Retrieves a company by its domain.

data.label: Clearbit
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Clearbit account.

children.text: Enter the name of the company you want to retrieve the domain for.
Triggers when a person you are subscribed to is updated.
Enter the name for the webhook.
Establish a connection to your Clearbit account
Allows you to perform a custom API call.

data.label: Clearbit
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Clearbit account.

children.text: version of the API is preferred to ensure synchronous response.
Select the HTTP method you want to use:
to retrieve information for an entry.
to make a partial entry update.
Enter the desired request headers. You don't have to add authorization headers; we already did that for you.
Enter the body content for your API call.

customCSS:
<style>
@media print {
  html, body {
    overflow-x: visible;
  }
}
#tally-widget-button {
  position: fixed !important;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  display: none;
  visibility: visible !important;
  opacity: 1 !important;
  color: #0C121D;
  border: 2px solid #0C121D;
  border-radius: 4px;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  font-size: 14px;
  font-weight: 600;
  font-family: 'Inter';
  text-align: center;
  box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
  cursor: pointer;
  z-index: 999999 !important;
  -webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent;
  outline: none;
  touch-action: manipulation;
  pointer-events: auto;
  transform: translate3d(0, 0, 0);
}
.button-text {
  display: inline-block;
  margin-right: 8px;
}
.button-text::before {
  content: attr(data-text);
}
#tally-widget-popup {
  position: fixed;
  background-color: white;
  display: none;
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 10px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
  z-index: 999999;
  overflow: hidden;
  border: 0px solid #0C121D;
  padding-top: 30px;
}
#tally-widget-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 10px;
  right: 10px;
  background: none;
  border: none;
  font-size: 36px;
  font-weight: bold;
  padding: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
  color: #0C121D;
}

  .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
    font-family: 'Inter' !important;
  }

  .dark .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #F6F6F6 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column > div > div > div.flex.flex-1.w-full.justify-center.pb-0 > div > div.flex.items-center.pl-0.pr-2.mb-5.xl\:-mt-1\.5 > div > div > div > div:nth-child(1) > div.flex.pr-2.text-gray-500.items-center {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  a.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-public-space-links-wrap .ab-public-space-link:first-of-type {
    border-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-toc-item-active a{
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 {
    text-decoration-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-left:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .ab-nav-left-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-right:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .ab-nav-right-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
#tally-inline-popup {
  position: fixed;
  display: none;
  z-index: 999999;
  width: min(420px, 90vw);
  height: min(550px, 80vh);
  background: #fff;
  color: #0c121d;
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.08);
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 12px 28px rgba(0,0,0,0.22), 0 2px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.12);
  overflow: hidden;
  padding: 5px;
}

#tally-inline-popup iframe {
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  border: 0;
  display: block;
  border-radius: 8px;
}

#tally-inline-popup .tip-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 6px;
  right: 8px;
  width: 32px;
  height: 32px;
  line-height: 28px;
  font-size: 22px;
  text-align: center;
  background: rgba(255,255,255,0.85);
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.06);
  border-radius: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
}

#main-column a[data-form-url],
#main-column a[data-tally-url] {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
  text-decoration: underline;
  text-underline-offset: 2px;
  text-decoration-thickness: 1.5px;
  font-weight: 600;
}

@media (max-width: 640px) {
  #tally-inline-popup {
    width: min(360px, 94vw);
    height: min(500px, 80vh);
  }
}

#main-column .ab-cta-button a.ab-cta-button {
  background-color: #7302D5;
}

/* Titles in purple */
.ab-link-blocks-wrapper .ab-link-block-item.ab-docs-card-mode .ab-link-block-content-wrap .font-bold {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
}

.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
}

</style>

reusableContentVariables.name: string
reusableContentVariables.description: a list or sequence of characters (like letters, numbers, and symbols) used to represent text in a computer programming.

reusableContentVariables.name: Operations
reusableContentVariables.description: An operation is a single module run to process data or check for new data.

reusableContentVariables.name: Credits
reusableContentVariables.description: Credits (formerly operations) are the currency for running scenarios.

reusableContentVariables.name: Route
reusableContentVariables.description: A route is a path that data can flow through in a scenario, visualized as the dotted lines between modules.
